text: Allen is a city in Lyon County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 160 people lived there. ==History== Allen was created in 1854. It was incorporated as a city in 1909. Allen was a station on the Missouri Pacific Railroad. ==Geography== Allen is at (38.656472, -96.170511). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Allen has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Allen has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Allen, Kansas ==People== Allen is part of the Emporia Micropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 160 people, 77 households, and 44 families living in Allen. Of the households, 68.8% owned their home and 31.2% rented their home. The median age was 43.0 years. Of the people, 87.5% were White, 1.9% were Asian, 4.4% were some other race, and 6.3% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 5.6% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 177 people, 77 households, and 46 families living in Allen. ===2000 census=== The 2000 census says that there were 211 people, 83 households, and 62 families living in Allen. ==Education== Allen is part of USD 251 North Lyon County. The Northern Heights High School is in Allen.
